Text: Thank you so much! I downloaded an earlier version of this that was in jpg format, and I didn't know how to put it all together and make it a cbr, so this is just perfect! Thanks again for all your hard work!

Making a CBZ or CBR is easy. You just take the appropriately named for numerical order files and place them in a ZIP or RAR archive. Thus the BBZ and CBR extenders.

Then change the file extension from ZIP or RAR to CBZ or CBR as appropriate. If you have a program like CDisplay installed, the file's icon should change to reflect the file type now being interpreted as a CBR file.
Thanks that other guy was HORRID scans especially all the blurring
